qas.question: What other American territory has these beetles that have infested Guam?
Where is the Coconut Beetle native to?
Where did the coconut rhinoceros beetle originate?
When was the coconut rhinoceros beetle discovered in American Samoa?

context: An infestation of the <a0_0>coconut rhinoceros beetle<a0_0/> (CRB), Oryctes rhinoceros, was detected on Guam on September 12, <b5_0>2007<b5_0/>. CRB is not known to occur in the United States except in <a1_0>American Samoa<a1_0/>. Delimiting surveys performed September 13–25, 2007 indicated that the infestation was limited to Tumon Bay and Faifai Beach, an area of approximately 900 acres (3.6 km2). Guam Department of Agriculture (GDA) placed quarantine on all properties within the Tumon area on October 5 and later expanded the quarantine to about <b3_0>2,500 acres<b3_0/> (<b7_0>10 km2<b7_0/>) on October 25; approximately <b6_0>0.5 miles<b6_0/> (800 m) radius in all directions from all known locations of CRB infestation. CRB is native to <a2_0>Southern Asia<a2_0/> and distributed throughout Asia and the Western Pacific including Sri Lanka, Upolu, Samoa, American Samoa, Palau, New Britain, <b4_0>West Irian<b4_0/>, New Ireland, Pak Island and Manus Island (New Guinea), Fiji, Cocos (Keeling) Islands, Mauritius, and Reunion.
